tasks.task: Transporting livestock and poultry while maintaining biosecurity.
subtasks: Learn about designated entry points on the farm/ranch.
Contact the farmer/rancher or check signs for entry procedures.
Allow the farm/ranch personnel to inspect the truck and trailer.
Clean or inspect the truck and trailer if needed, including removing mud, manure, or dirt.
Sign admittance forms or logs as required by the farm/ranch.

tasks.task: Examine necessary documentation for livestock transportation.
subtasks: Verify the certificate of veterinary inspection (CVI) as needed.
Check for certificate of brand inspection if applicable.
Confirm the bill of lading listing the animals on the truck.
Verify the bill of sale if a change of ownership is involved.

tasks.task: Prepare the truck and trailer for transporting livestock.
subtasks: Ensure clean footwear and coveralls are worn when handling animals.
Check that clean, unused bedding is present on the trailer.
Confirm that cleanouts are closed to prevent manure release during transport.
Examine and load animals, ensuring none are sick or injured.
Double-check paperwork for accuracy upon loading.
Ensure all gates are closed after loading and log departure time.

tasks.task: Admit to the premises when delivering animals.
subtasks: Contact the farmer/rancher to request admittance.
Follow the designated route provided by the farm/ranch.
Sign in and provide contact information if required.

tasks.task: Unload livestock and ensure proper documentation.
subtasks: Verify required paperwork again with the farmer/rancher.
Confirm the number and classes of animals unloaded.
Document each animal's identification if necessary.
Isolate sick or injured animals immediately upon unloading.
Move the truck/trailer to a cleaning area upon departure.
Hoose down the truck/trailer to remove manure.
Clean the truck/trailer thoroughly if immediate cleaning is not possible.
Document the condition of the equipment before and after transport.
